content:
Adding words to the user dictionary only means they aren't flagged as misspelled by the spell check. They aren't added to the list of suggested spellings.

This has been requested for 17 years: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338291
creator: sfhowes

content:
Are you using an imap or pop mail account ?

re :Today I transferred some files from one mailbox (Mailbox A) to another (Mailbox B)

Is Mailbox A and Mailbox B in the same mail account? OR Is Mailbox A in an imap account and Mailbox B in the 'Local Folders' mail account ?

If you move messages out of an imap folder and put them into another mail account eg: Local Folders mail account, then the 'move' is in effect taking the email out of the imap account and off the server.

If you did not download full copies in the imap account then you are only putting headers into the 'Local Folders' mail account in which case you have not got a copy of the email.

What is 'Mailbox A' - it the 'Inbox' or another folder you created? Is that folder set up to download/receive full copies of emails or not?

  • Account Settings > Synchronisation & Storage
  • click on 'Advanced'
  • Is 'Mailbox A' checkbox selected to download full copies?

Do you have an Anti-Virus which is allowed to scan any opened files?


I would strongly advise you: A) check the following: Make sure you are actually downloading full copies of emails into the Imap account folders.

B) When you want to 'move' emails from A to B, do not use 'Move to' - use 'Copy-to' because then you can check whether you can access those copied emails. If something fails then at least you have not lost the original off the server, so can repeat the action. Only delete emails once you are sure you have good copies in the 'Local Folders' mail account.

C) Do not allow Anti-Virus or cleanup software like CCleaner or Wisecleaner to scan anything in your profile folders. They cause havoc.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
To sort by tags, first enable the Tags column in Table View, then sorting by tags is available in Table or Cards View.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1428753#answer-1634186

Or, enable Tags under View/Folders so that particular tags can be selected in the Folder Pane. Press Alt if the Menu Bar with View is hidden, or select View from the 3-bar menu icon.
creator: sfhowes

content:
The Tag called Important, is usually a tag that most servers also recognise.

So if server (webmail account) is applying an 'Important' tag to email then it's likely Thunderbird will recognise it and also display it. Logon to webmail acount and check to see if there are any Message Filters or other server settings which are applying 'tags' to emails.

If you have viewed emails via another device like a phone and applied an Important tag then server gets updated and thus an imap account will also display it. Or if someone else is also accessing that same Imap account then whatever they set will also get auto updated to server and hence to your imap account as well.

In Thunderbird: If you have created any 'Message Filters' then do any of those filters have an action to 'Tag Message' with 'Important' ? Check your Message Filters.

By any chance, could you be applying the 'Important' tag by accident ? If you select and email in list and press the number 1 key - this is a shortcut to applying the 'Important' tag to email.

Not sure if mean 'Tag' or whether you mean 'Important' folder. eg: Gmail imap accounts may display an 'Important' folder and gmail does have the ability to decide whether an email is 'Important' and thus can add a second label so same email can display in both Inbox and Important folder at same time. Fortunately, you can access webmail account and alter settings to stop gmail doing it.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Just a thought but do you have a Nextcloud server?

A few years ago I came across a similar case after someone posted a bug. It turned out that the bug was not in Thunderbird, but it was the server. At that time it seemed to be nextcloud mail issue and could be resolved if you turn off the Automatic message importance classification.

I did locate this link which seems nextcloud still has the ability to set email with Important tag. https://help.nextcloud.com/t/emails-are-tagged-as-important/177109

This link also mentions it's by design. https://nextcloud.com/blog/nextcloud-mail-introduces-machine-learning-for-priority-inbox/

content: Yes, you can do that. - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to profile folder, click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird - you are now in the profile. copy the addressbooks, abook.sqlite and history.sqlite to a safe place - POP messages will be in Mail folder, such as inbox and inbox.msf and local folders will be in Mail\Local Folders - Copy everything in the POPaccount folder. - If IMAP accounts, they will regenerate when set up again. - when you have saved all that you want, - uninstall thunderbird - delete c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder this ensures a fresh restart - install thunderbird - set up POP account and exit without downloading messages. - exit thunderbird - copy the saved POP folders to the Mail\<popaccount> folder and the local folders to Mail\Local Folders. You will be prompted for overwrites. Allow - copy the abook.sqlite and the history.sqlite into the root of the profile - start thunderbird and add any IMAP accounts.

content:
First, I am assuming all data folders are messages. If you have any local folders, they need to be protected. Here are my suggested steps: - if there are any local folder items, I suggest copying the elsewhere (exit thunderbird, locate the Mail\Local Folders folder and copy to a separate folder.) - Now, uninstall thunderbird - delete c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder - that will give you a clean start - install thunderbird and exit - now copy the prior local folders content to the new Mail\Local Folders folder - IF you do not like threading, this is the opportunity to fix it prior to creating accounts 

     - create a simple text file with name of user.js with these lines:            // Set default threading to UNthreaded  ###   <== this line is optional, just for documentation           user_pref("mailnews.default_view_flags", 0);       - copy the user.js file into the profile

- Now, start Thunderbird and install each of the accounts. - When done, be sure to do a full backup. My preferred backup that works is this: 

  - exit thunderbird    - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to a USB stick

- Now, if you ever have to reinstall, all you have to do is 

   - install thunderbird and exit     - copy the USB stick Thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming   - it will prompt for overwrite - allow that

If you have difficulties, please post details. And, I'm pleased you're learning stuff... :)
creator: davidsk

content:
You need to identify why your mail is no longer in the mail server! or Thunderbird thinks it is not.

Thunderbird's first action on connecting to an IMAP server is to bring the local message store inline with the server one. IF the server mail is not available or is not there anymore, Thunderbird deletes the local cache to match the server.

content:
Inbox (no extension) mbox files get created only if you have selected to download full copies of emails. Inbox.msf files are index files used by Thunderbird.

I'm assuming this is an Imap mail account. Have you selected to download full copies to Inbox of that account? Check settings:

  • 'Account Settings' > 'Synchronisation & Storage' - for the imap account
  • click on 'Advanced' button
  • Make sure the checkboxes are selected for any folder and subfolder which you want to download full copies.
  • click on 'OK'

When you start Thunderbird the first thing that occurs is to check with server. If does not exist on server or Inbox.msf file does not match what is on server or in Inbox mbox file then it's all out of synch. You cannot simply paste any mbox file into an imap mail account profile folder whilst Thunderbird is not running and expect it to magically appear. You can only do that with Pop accounts because they do not synchronise with anything on server. The only way to get emails back onto a server is to paste the file into 'Local Folders' mail account and then after starting Thunderbird, you can gradually copy back to the Imap account Inbox and then they get uploaded to server.

After you have checked your Account Settings to ensure you really are downloading full copies. I would try this:

If you have an Inbox in imap account:

  • Make sure you are in Online mode
  • Right click on Inbox folder and select 'Properties'
  • click on 'Repair Folder'
  • click on 'OK'

If you cannot see an Inbox or the above did not work then try this:

  • Exit Thunderbird
  • Access profile name folder - in ../ImapMail/imap mail account folder
  • Delete the 'Inbox.msf' file
  • Then start Thunderbird and make sure you are in Online mode otherwise nothing connects.

Of course, if you logon to the webmail account via a browser and discover nothing in server Inbox then an imap account is not going to see anything either because it can only show what is on server. So...what do you see in webmail account Inbox?

content: I am not aware of a spam tool that looks at raw HTML. However, if there is a header that is interesting, you can add that to the filter. For example, Newsgroups is not a default filter option, but since it is a legitimate header entry, I was successful in creating a filter to run off of it. Another approach is software: mailwasher is free for just one account and does an excellent job of spam management. Another option is to create a gmail account, and import your mail through gmail: that lets you then use gmail's filter tools for your account.

Hello there

Your mouse may not be responding as it should if you have a separate mouse such as wireless or otherwise you could check to see if your drivers for this device are out of date or simply need to be updated again.

Another subject could also be the culprit.

There could also be another topic that is the culprit, I can suggest you merge this into other related topics almost identical to yours.

By this I mean that I can provide you with a laundry list of solutions.

by this I mean that you should be able to run this list in order to minimize or eliminate this topic from incorrect use with it.

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there

Restart the affected app or editor Check for updates

The Thunderbird software check for conflicts with other software. Please try a reset for the Thunderbird app

Restart the device for example. Update the device. Repair or reinstall software Check for malware or viruses Check for conflicts with other programs.

Check for hardware problems.

Check your RAM usage so that you do not experience freeze moments.

Freezing usually returns to the ram using its reaction capabilities.

You may also be causing this due to missing or missed updated devices you are working with.

it could also be a button that you have not switched on, for example. It can also be in a small corner.


Greetings Firefox volunteer

content:
The gmail smtp has 'normal password' authentication, instead of OAuth2, like the incoming. Remove the smtp:// entry for the account in Saved Passwords in Settings/Privacy & Security, restart TB, send a test message from the gmail account. You might have to enter the account password in an OAuth browser window, although the existing token in Saved Passwords for the incoming should apply to incoming and outgoing.

Consider updating your outlook settings:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1417298#answer-1588949
creator: sfhowes

content: Access the Google calendar in your browser, click the + icon next to 'Other calendars' to add a calendar, 'Browse calendars of interest', Regional holidays, Browse all, select Holidays in United States. In TB, add a new calendar 'On the network', enter your gmail address..., then select the holiday calendar.
creator: sfhowes

content:
It was easy to subscribe to Google's holiday calendar with @fshowes instructions. In case it's not obvious to everyone, here is a more detailed how-to:

  • New Calendar (lower left)
  • On the Network
  • Enter Gmail address as "Username," "Location" automatically fills in as gmail.com
  • Sign-in process (gmail + password + verification)
  • "Create New Calendar" dialog shows available calendars
  • Select the calendar(s) you want.
creator: vknowles

content:
I found it easy to follow the instruction from sfhowes, but in case anyone would like a more detailed how-to:

  • New Calendar (lower left)
  • On the Network
  • Enter Gmail address as "Username," "Location" automatically fills in as gmail.com
  • Sign-in process (gmail + password + verification)
  • "Create New Calendar" dialog displays available calendars
  • Select the calendar(s) you want.
creator: vknowles

content: Well, to my knowledge Thunderbird is not changing. In fact, we regularly see questions from people migrating from Outlook to Thunderbird, so it seems the traffic is coming our way, not the other way. Would you mind sharing what you're hearing that is to encourage a shift to Outlook? Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: A possibility: - exit thunderbird - in proflle folder, under the Mail folder, locate your POP account and copy the message folders to the Mail\Local folders folder. You may want to rename to keep them separate from other local folders. - restart thunderbird and verify that the folders are accessible in Local folders. - Now you can delete the POP account - For your protection, whenever doing something such as this, I encourage doing a full backup of the profile when TB is not running to ensure that everything is saved in case a mistake is made.
creator: davidsk

No where can I see "Psypower.co.uk" or any of it's sub folders.

content: You are showing us snippets of your account info. To answer all you questions, we might need to see screenshots of many components. And, jumping ahead, if all your message folders are in Local Folders, you can safely remove the POP account and create new accounts. To be safe, do full backup (with TB not running) of the profile.
creator: davidsk

content: Please post details of how you transferred to the new PC. That may prove helpful. Is the old PC still available? Are these Windows PCs?
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird does all of that, has been around for 20+ years, used by 10s of 1,000s, and by many businesses. However, no software can guarantee no problems ever, although I have never had a problem. If you're using as a business, I encourage doing periodic backups, not because Thunderbird is fragile, but because it's for a business. I am amazed at the number of businesses that post here with a problem and have years of data lost because they never ran backups. Thunderbird is easy to setup. If you have questions at any time, just post them here.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for the response. OUTLOOK was a years ago problem long forgotten by never gotten over. I have people that "back up" but who is to say they do what they are paid to do? I certainly have been led down the rosey path a few times only to get the thorns they'd been saving to thrust on me at will.

Is there someone knowledgeable that does this sort of set up/maintenance/gal or guy Friday that is worth their fare?
creator: davidjdunworth

content: Thunderbird is easy to backup, provided you follow some guidelines, but my inference is that you are seeking to hire someone to manage your accounts? If so, that isn't a service provided here -- although, I can give instructions on the best way to do that if you do eventually decide to use Thunderbird. And, YES, I have seen many people post here for assistance who had backups that did not work.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello there We have read the message. We try to help


You write that you can no longer send outgoing messages.

Try viewing your outgoing server details in your Thunderbird Software.

These settings are set as they are normally set for use.

After an update, some miscommunication could have arisen, resulting in a situation similar to yours.

Together we can see whether this can be completed so that it works as it should again.

Can you send me a screenshot of your outgoing SMTP server settings for email use? This is probably installed in your Thunderbird software on your desktop.


https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-to-make-screenshots


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

notifications of other topics.

content:
Hello there

This may involve Authentication for your server use that can be set in your account for which you would need your email address and a password, your verification is required in order to be able to use authentication for the Thunderbird server in question.(email-client). Please set this option in your outgoing server configuration.(after that)

Did you already tried that one? You where talking about passwords.

The authentic SMTP -protocol can be missing or not checked in the check box.

Anti virus turned off? Does it work better then? Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Have you been to passwords in Thunderbird and removed that which it has saved for your outgoing server at comcast or edited it to correct it.

The error message is saying you have had to many failed password attempts. I am guessing the saved password is not correct and Thunderbird is retrying until Comcast crack it and refuse more tries.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
We don't have a "Local Files". Do you mean "Local Folders"? These would be only on your machine.

Check Help > Troubleshoot Information > about:profiles for other possible locations of data.

And of course your backup.
creator: wsmwk

content:
If there is a bounce, that is not something you can do in your Thunderbird. The SENDER must fix the problem of why it is not getting through.

That said, it is unlikely anyone can help you solve this problem unless you post the EXACT error mesage the sender is seeing.
creator: wsmwk
